verses.roman:
harasya jṛmbhaṇaṁ yuddhe
bāṇasya bhuja-kṛntanam
prāgjyotiṣa-patiṁ hatvā
kanyānāṁ haraṇaṁ ca yat

synonyms: harasya—of Lord Śiva; jṛmbhaṇam—the forced yawning; yuddhe—in battle; bāṇasya—of Bāṇa; bhuja—of the arms; kṛntanam—the cutting,; prāgjyotiṣa-patim—the master of the city Prāgjyotiṣa; hatvā—killing; kanyānām—of the unmarried virgins; haraṇam—the removal; ca—and; yat—which.
translation: Also narrated are how Lord Kṛṣṇa, in the battle with Bāṇāsura, defeated Lord Śiva by making him yawn, how the Lord cut off Bāṇāsura's arms, and how He killed the master of Prāgjyotiṣapura and then rescued the young princesses held captive in that city.
